greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of directed loopless multigraphs with n arcs and k vertices.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325 (antidiagonals 0..50)
program: (PARI) \\ here G(k,x) gives column k as rational function.
permcount(v) = {my(m=1, s=0, k=0, t); for(i=1, #v, t=v[i]; k=if(i>1&&t==v[i-1], k+1, 1); m*=t*k; s+=t); s!/m}
edges(v, t) = {prod(i=2, #v, prod(j=1, i-1, my(g=gcd(v[i], v[j])); t(v[i]*v[j]/g)^(2*g))) * prod(i=1, #v, t(v[i])^(v[i]-1))}
G(n, x)={my(s=0); forpart(p=n, s+=permcount(p)/edges(p, i->1-x^i)); s/n!}
T(n)={Mat(vector(n+1, k, Col(O(y*y^n) + G(k-1, y + O(y*y^n)))))}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 16 2020
